derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English (in the sense 'manger'), of Germanic origin; related to Dutch krib, kribbe and German Krippe

entry.def: A crib is a bed for a small baby.
If you crib, you copy something that someone else has written and pretend that it is your own work.

example.ex: You have been cribbing from Bennett...
He had been caught cribbing in an exam.

means.word_mean: 2. a literal translation used in studying a foreign language (often used illicitly)
3. a card game in which each player is dealt 6 cards and discards one or two to make up the crib
1. use a crib, as in an exam

jushi.english: The lazy student cribbed the composition off me.
